refnamediv.refpurpose: Allow interactive control of the RTS2 system.

refsect1.title: BASIC OPERATION
refsect1.para: Probably the most basic operation is to switch system states. Please press F2, F3, or F4 keys to switch states. To switch system to on, you will press F4. When system is in on, it is observing.

To switch system to off, please press F2 key. To switch to standby, use F3 keys. Use off state when you are sure you will not observe, or use F3 key and standby mode when you think you might be able to observe later tonight.

After you press key to change state, small confirmation window will appear. Use left and right keys and enter key to confirm your selection. You most probably would like to press enter key to confirm selected yes.

refsect1.title: RTS2-MON SCREEN
refsect1.para: When you run rts2-mon, screen is divided into four principal areas - menu bar, device list and status display, RTS2 messages space and status bar at bottom.

Standart screen layout will display following elements:
menu
This is the uppermost line of the screen. You can enter menu pressing F9 key, and exit it pressing ESC key. In menu you will find generic command to switch RTS2 to off, standby and on states.
device listing
Devices are listed in left part of the screen. You can use up and down arrows to move between devices. Once you have selected device which you want, press TAB key to move to the variable listing.
variable list
The center and left part of the screen holds information about RTS2 device variables, or device states. For central server, list of devices and their states will be shown.
log window
Log window display messages, as they are passed through RTS2 system. Those messages include debug messages. To change filter which governs which message will be displayed, go to the menu and select "Debug" option.
status bar
Status bar display current system status. Left is system state (on, standby or off and substate - day, night, etc..), right is current UT.

refsect2.title: State switching keys
refsect2.para: RTS2 state can be switched by F2, F3 and F4 keys. After you press that key, message dialog with question to confirm state change appear. You can use arrow keys to change answer, and confirm the message box by pressing enter. If you choose Yes as answer to question, RTS2 state will be changed.
For detailed discussions of various states, please see rts27.
